special_programs: UNESCO school (vrede & mensenrechten, intercultureel leren, wereldburgerschap, duurzaamheid)

facilities.classrooms_labs_quality: Modern facilities with ICT integration throughout curriculum

technology.description: ICT curriculum integration across all subjects

diversity.description: UNESCO school with focus on intercultural learning and global citizenship

environment.culture_values: School motto: 'Met oog voor jou' (With an eye for you). As a UNESCO school, emphasizes peace & human rights, intercultural learning, global citizenship, and sustainability. Focus on individual attention and developing well-rounded students through academic excellence, gifted education programs, and technological innovation.

admission_info: Voorrangsregels: leerlingen uit Amstelveen, Ouderkerk a/d Amstel, Badhoevedorp en Aalsmeer, en kinderen van oud-leerlingen

strengths: UNESCO school with strong focus on global citizenship, peace, human rights, and sustainability
Certified Begaafdheidsprofielschool offering specialized gifted education programs
Multiple VWO tracks including Gymnasium and Technasium for diverse academic interests
Strong technology integration with Technasium and ICT curriculum
Cambridge English certificates for international language credentials
Comprehensive student support including psychologist, remedial teacher, and specialized programs
Large enrollment (~1,900 students) providing diverse peer community and extensive program offerings
Located in Amstelveen with priority admission for local students
Personal approach with motto 'Met oog voor jou' (With an eye for you)
considerations: Roman Catholic affiliation may influence school culture and values
Large school size may not suit students preferring intimate environments
HAVO/VWO only - no VMBO tracks available
Priority given to students from specific municipalities (Amstelveen, Ouderkerk a/d Amstel, Badhoevedorp, Aalsmeer)
Multiple specialized tracks may require early decision-making about academic direction
best_fit_for: Students with strong academic performance interested in HAVO or VWO education
Gifted students who would benefit from Begaafdheidsprofielschool programs
Students interested in science, technology, and innovation (Technasium track)
Students who value global citizenship, intercultural learning, and sustainability (UNESCO focus)
Students from Amstelveen, Ouderkerk a/d Amstel, Badhoevedorp, or Aalsmeer
Children of alumni who qualify for priority admission
Students seeking internationally recognized English qualifications (Cambridge certificates)
Students who appreciate both academic excellence and personal attention in a larger school setting
ai_analysis.summary: Keizer Karel College is a distinguished Roman Catholic secondary school in Amstelveen offering HAVO and VWO education with multiple specialized tracks. With UNESCO school status and Begaafdheidsprofielschool certification, the school combines academic excellence with a strong commitment to global citizenship, peace, human rights, and sustainability. The school offers diverse pathways including Gymnasium, Technasium, and standard tracks, all enhanced by ICT integration and Cambridge English programs. With approximately 1,900 students, it provides a robust educational environment while maintaining its motto 'Met oog voor jou' - emphasizing individual attention and care. The comprehensive student support system includes remedial teachers, school psychologists, and specialized programs for test anxiety and social skills. Best suited for academically strong students living in the Amstelveen region who value both traditional academic rigor and progressive global citizenship education.

data_sources: School contact details and open days 2026
